name: 量化研究法
description: The course begins with an overview of social research, and of several quantitative research methods frequently used in social science research.  Next, it focuses on learning statistical concepts needed to answer specific quantitative research questions. Thereafter it focuses on survey research, including survey administration. It then reviews the elements of quantitative research design, and in the end requires the students to conduct statistical analysis of the data obtained through the methods, and to present the research findings to the class.
goals: To become familiar with the characteristics, language and logic of quantitative research
To understand the available techniques for designing a quantitative research study
To understand the available techniques for quantitative data analysis
To be able to recognize and assess quality and rigor in evaluating a quantitative research
syllabus:
Session 1 (week1-2): Overview of Course

• Understanding the characteristics, language and contributions of quantitative research 

• Distinctions between quantitative and quantitative research approaches and methods

• Session overview, assignments, expectations, etc.

• Student introductions and research interests

Session 2 (week3-6): research Design and Data Collection

• Designing research questions

• Sampling

• IRB issues 

• Designing an interview guide and interview questions 

• Interviewing

• Brief overview of field observation and other methods 

Session 3 (week7-9): Quantitative Data Collection Theory and Codebook Development

• Quantitative schools of thought

• Initial thoughts on quantitative analysis 

•Codebook development

Session 4 (week10-12): Writing About Quantitative Research 

• Publishing quantitative research (Guest Lecturer: Bob Arnold)

• Writing up the quantitative data collection methods

Session 5 (week12-14): Quantitative Data Analysis

• Coding

• Building analysis/theory 

• Working with teams

•reliability

Session 6 (week15-16): Mixed Methods and Quantitative software

• Combining quantitative and quantitative methods 

• Software tools, data tracking and management 

• Writing up the thematic analysis section of an article

Session 7 (week17-18) Overview and assessment of course

• Discussion of final papers
